article.headline: George Mason 75, Drexel 72 (OT )
article.story: FAIRFAX, Va. (AP)-- Jai Lewis scored six of his 19 points in overtime and Lamar Butler hit the 3-pointer that put George Mason ahead to stay in its 75-72 win over Drexel Saturday night. Lewis, who also finished with 11 rebounds, was fortunate to get a chance in overtime after he missed a short jumper in the lane with nine seconds left in regulation and the Patriots (16-7, 9-5 Colonial Athletic Association) down by two. However, Terry Reynolds, who also hit two important free throws in extra time, sent the game into overtime tied at 64 by making a layup with one second left after Drexel's Bashir Mason missed two potential game-clinching free throws after the Lewis miss. Kevin Mickens finished with a career-high 17 points for the Patriots, hitting all seven of his shots from the floor. Saturday's loss, along with wins by Virginia Commonwealth and Old Dominion, sends Drexel (15-8, 10-4) into a three-way tie atop the conference standings. The loss also snap's Drexel's six-game winning streak. Tim Whitworth scored 18 points to lead the Dragons, including three 3-pointers. Drexel stayed close despite Lewis's six points in overtime, but couldn't rally after Butler's 3-pointer that put the Patriots ahead 73-70 with less than two minutes to play.
